721149f-a.title: Manhattan: MacDougal Alley - MacDougal Street
721149f-a.text:
9 MacDougal Alley, north side, east of MacDougal Street.
August 27, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
721149f-a.folder: MacDougal Alley & MacDougal Street, Manhattan, NY

721150f-a.title: Manhattan: MacDougal Alley - MacDougal Street
721150f-a.text:
MacDougal Alley, east from MacDougal Street; a short dead end thoroughfare extending to but not entering on Fifth Avenue. The small structures shown were stables that have been renovated into studio apartments. In the background are two of the dominant features of this area. That on the left is the apartment hotel, No. 1 Fifth Ave. To the right of center is the towering residential unit,
No. 1 University Place.
1939-40
Alexandr Alland, photo
721150f-a.folder: MacDougal Alley & MacDougal Street, Manhattan, NY

721146f-a.title: Manhattan: MacDougal Alley - MacDougal Street
721146f-a.text:
(1)
3-5 MacDougal Alley, north side, east of and adjoining MacDougal Street. No. 3 is evidently occupied by an artist, note the pictures hanging on the front of the studio to be sold.
August 27, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing more of the building on the right.
August 27, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
Neg ~1275

721174f-a.title: Manhattan: MacDougal Street - MacDougal Alley
721174f-a.text:
(1)
MacDougal Street at the N.E. corner of MacDougal Alley (1.v.). This is a rear house connected with 30 West 8th Street, and contains the Jumble Shop Restaurant. During the summer tables for patrons are
set outside the back door in MacDougal Alley.
May 24, 1933.
L. Sperr.
(2)
The same view, showing the Outdoor Art Exhibit.
June 2, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
721174f-a.folder: MacDougal Street & MacDougal Alley, Manhattan, NY
